meanings.definition: To make lateral or to move to one side.
meanings.sent1: She was lateralizing the books on the shelf to make more space.
meanings.sent2: The car was lateralizing into the parking spot smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The cat was lateralizing its toy mouse playfully around the room.
meanings.sent4: The river was lateralizing its flow around the bend.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's graceful movements were lateralizing across the stage.

meanings.sent1: He lateralized the ball towards his teammate during the game.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind was lateralizing the branches of the trees.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was lateralizing the nuts away from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The magnet was lateralizing the metal objects towards it.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was lateralizing the students into groups for the project.

meanings.sent1: The boat lateralized slightly as it turned around the buoy.
meanings.sent2: The toddler was lateralizing towards the colorful toy on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The sandwich was lateralizing in his lunchbox, making it hard to close.
meanings.sent4: The sun was lateralizing towards the horizon, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The snow was lateralizing off the roof in big chunks after the storm.
